channel.title: Lethal Steel
channel.description:
http://soundcloud.com/lethal-steel-1/sets
Couple of friends from Stockholm, they got together and did this demo in less than 2 weeks, i am quite impressed!

item.title: Lethal Steel
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

Speljohan:

Heavy, Thrash, Speed mostly.

Ahh, nice. I used to play a lot of heavy metal but I kinda went off it haha.

Read full topic

item.title: Lethal Steel
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Ruby Forums Coder, post:9, topic:445225”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=547907.msg4017526#msg4017526 date=1339761107]

[quote author=Ruby Forums Coder link=topic=547907.msg4017519#msg4017519 date=1339760164]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=547907.msg4017517#msg4017517 date=1339759674]

They sound pretty good for only playing together a few weeks. The lead guitarist needs to work on his palm-mute touch though, he should vary the weight of his palm on the strings rather than just keeping it the same for every song, it adds a new tone to each track therefore helping varying their songs. They’re really good for their play time though.
[/quote]Yer, i noticed that too. I reckon it’ll get better, i have no clue how long he has played Guitar really.

It’ll get better the longer they play together and when they actually find their own sound and perfect it.

It sounds to me like he’s played for around 2-3 years, maybe longer. Although the way he plays it seems like he only focuses on heavy metal and metal core styles of playing. If you know him personally then you should suggest to him to branch out his style into blues, his weak points are his solos, and blues helps a lot with solos because a lot of blues can be used as improvisation and helps the player create better solos.
[/quote]As a Guitarist i’m aware. Neways, i don’t hear any kind of Metalcore influence in this at all. More like early NWOBHM with the Swedish flavour (Gotham City, Neptune, Heavy Load)

I didn’t realise you played, I teach a small group of people at the weekends, I’ve been playing for about 8 years now, I love guitar.

I hear a metalcore influence in “Don’t look back” although, it could also be mistaken for a more modern heavy metal sound.
[/quote]If anything, Metalcore took that from NWOBHM ^^

Haha

So, what kind of stuff do you play?[/quote]Heavy, Thrash, Speed mostly.

Read full topic

They sound pretty good for only playing together a few weeks. The lead guitarist needs to work on his palm-mute touch though, he should vary the weight of his palm on the strings rather than just keeping it the same for every song, it adds a new tone to each track therefore helping varying their songs. They’re really good for their play time though.

It’ll get better the longer they play together and when they actually find their own sound and perfect it.

It sounds to me like he’s played for around 2-3 years, maybe longer. Although the way he plays it seems like he only focuses on heavy metal and metal core styles of playing. If you know him personally then you should suggest to him to branch out his style into blues, his weak points are his solos, and blues helps a lot with solos because a lot of blues can be used as improvisation and helps the player create better solos.
[/quote]As a Guitarist i’m aware. Neways, i don’t hear any kind of Metalcore influence in this at all. More like early NWOBHM with the Swedish flavour (Gotham City, Neptune, Heavy Load)

[/quote]If anything, Metalcore took that from NWOBHM ^^[/quote]
Haha

item.title: Lethal Steel
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Ruby Forums Coder, post:7, topic:445225”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=547907.msg4017517#msg4017517 date=1339759674]

[quote author=Ruby Forums Coder link=topic=547907.msg4017516#msg4017516 date=1339759429]

They sound pretty good for only playing together a few weeks. The lead guitarist needs to work on his palm-mute touch though, he should vary the weight of his palm on the strings rather than just keeping it the same for every song, it adds a new tone to each track therefore helping varying their songs. They’re really good for their play time though.
[/quote]Yer, i noticed that too. I reckon it’ll get better, i have no clue how long he has played Guitar really.

It’ll get better the longer they play together and when they actually find their own sound and perfect it.

It sounds to me like he’s played for around 2-3 years, maybe longer. Although the way he plays it seems like he only focuses on heavy metal and metal core styles of playing. If you know him personally then you should suggest to him to branch out his style into blues, his weak points are his solos, and blues helps a lot with solos because a lot of blues can be used as improvisation and helps the player create better solos.
[/quote]As a Guitarist i’m aware. Neways, i don’t hear any kind of Metalcore influence in this at all. More like early NWOBHM with the Swedish flavour (Gotham City, Neptune, Heavy Load)

I didn’t realise you played, I teach a small group of people at the weekends, I’ve been playing for about 8 years now, I love guitar.

I hear a metalcore influence in “Don’t look back” although, it could also be mistaken for a more modern heavy metal sound.[/quote]If anything, Metalcore took that from NWOBHM ^^

item.title: Lethal Steel
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:6, topic:445225”][quote author=Ruby Forums Coder link=topic=547907.msg4017516#msg4017516 date=1339759429]

[quote author=Speljohan link=topic=547907.msg4017509#msg4017509 date=1339757799]

They sound pretty good for only playing together a few weeks. The lead guitarist needs to work on his palm-mute touch though, he should vary the weight of his palm on the strings rather than just keeping it the same for every song, it adds a new tone to each track therefore helping varying their songs. They’re really good for their play time though.
[/quote]Yer, i noticed that too. I reckon it’ll get better, i have no clue how long he has played Guitar really.

It’ll get better the longer they play together and when they actually find their own sound and perfect it.

It sounds to me like he’s played for around 2-3 years, maybe longer. Although the way he plays it seems like he only focuses on heavy metal and metal core styles of playing. If you know him personally then you should suggest to him to branch out his style into blues, his weak points are his solos, and blues helps a lot with solos because a lot of blues can be used as improvisation and helps the player create better solos.
[/quote]As a Guitarist i’m aware. Neways, i don’t hear any kind of Metalcore influence in this at all. More like early NWOBHM with the Swedish flavour (Gotham City, Neptune, Heavy Load)[/quote]

I didn’t realise you played, I teach a small group of people at the weekends, I’ve been playing for about 8 years now, I love guitar.

I hear a metalcore influence in “Don’t look back” although, it could also be mistaken for a more modern heavy metal sound.

Read full topic

item.title: Lethal Steel
item.dc:creator: @Speljohan Speljohan
item.description:
@Speljohan wrote:

[quote=“Ruby Forums Coder, post:5, topic:445225”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=547907.msg4017509#msg4017509 date=1339757799]

They sound pretty good for only playing together a few weeks. The lead guitarist needs to work on his palm-mute touch though, he should vary the weight of his palm on the strings rather than just keeping it the same for every song, it adds a new tone to each track therefore helping varying their songs. They’re really good for their play time though.
[/quote]Yer, i noticed that too. I reckon it’ll get better, i have no clue how long he has played Guitar really.

It’ll get better the longer they play together and when they actually find their own sound and perfect it.

It sounds to me like he’s played for around 2-3 years, maybe longer. Although the way he plays it seems like he only focuses on heavy metal and metal core styles of playing. If you know him personally then you should suggest to him to branch out his style into blues, his weak points are his solos, and blues helps a lot with solos because a lot of blues can be used as improvisation and helps the player create better solos.[/quote]As a Guitarist i’m aware. Neways, i don’t hear any kind of Metalcore influence in this at all. More like early NWOBHM with the Swedish flavour (Gotham City, Neptune, Heavy Load)

Read full topic

item.title: Lethal Steel
item.dc:creator: @Ruby_Forums_Coder Ruby
item.description:
@Ruby_Forums_Coder wrote:

[quote=“Speljohan, post:4, topic:445225”][quote author=Ruby Forums Coder link=topic=547907.msg4017504#msg4017504 date=1339756854]
They sound pretty good for only playing together a few weeks. The lead guitarist needs to work on his palm-mute touch though, he should vary the weight of his palm on the strings rather than just keeping it the same for every song, it adds a new tone to each track therefore helping varying their songs. They’re really good for their play time though.
[/quote]Yer, i noticed that too. I reckon it’ll get better, i have no clue how long he has played Guitar really.[/quote]
It’ll get better the longer they play together and when they actually find their own sound and perfect it.

It sounds to me like he’s played for around 2-3 years, maybe longer. Although the way he plays it seems like he only focuses on heavy metal and metal core styles of playing. If you know him personally then you should suggest to him to branch out his style into blues, his weak points are his solos, and blues helps a lot with solos because a lot of blues can be used as improvisation and helps the player create better solos.

Read full topic
